13411699.review:
EDIT: This game is bigger than the old version, which this review is mostly based off of. The old version is still fun, but this one is even better!

I am so happy this game was greenlit. I purchased it originally from the dev a while back, and its a game that I am proud to have supported.

SanctuaryRPG takes a page from the old ASCII BBS games such as LORD and Exitilus. It is a work of ASCII art, proof positive that you dont need cutting edge graphics to make a great game. Each scene is rendered in ASCII art, and in cases there are hidden areas you can get to by pressing a key corresponding to a letter hidden in the picture. And its well-done ASCII art too.

It also has some of the best chiptunes to come out of a game in recent years. The music is just *awesome*. The fight music is probably the song I like the best. It really captures being in front of your NES, on the final boss that it took you hours and hours to get to.

The gameplay is simple. And like I said earlier, is reminiscent of the old BBS games. Its entirely keyboard driven, You wander from area to area, fighting monsters, exploring, travelling, and following the story. Random events happen as you "travel" - each area has a level. Going there triggers a fight (mostly), item drop, or random event.. These could be anything from an NPC, some loot, a story event, or even a secret area if you happen to find it on the map. To get from place to place - you press a key from a list. Theres hidden areas too. On the ASCII map, say theres an X in a door. Well you'd press X to go that way. Theres plenty of hidden places if you look for them.

Combat, as the rest of the game is keyboard driven. You see your enemies health, and yours, a list of about 5-8 different things you can do, and a basic status of the enemy. There are plenty of options to choose from, and you can link diffrent combos and finishing moved together by expirimenting with the combat options. You also get overkill moves by accumulating rage points, or the enemy may gain a status buff/debuff or put one on you, causing you to have to break its guard, heal your bleeding, and so forth.

However, fighting can get repetitive after a while. At least with the class I was playing, the same combo pretty much always worked, so I was just grinding through enemies over and over. Boss fights were a different story, and kept you on your toes as you switched your tactics constantly.

The possibility of fights becoming a bit grindy one of the few (admittedly minor) downsides, and my version was much older than this one, so it may have been changed.

The game is humorous, with plenty of gamer jokes and amusement, but it never feels like its beating you over the head with the silly factor . Its also suprisingly complex. Theres an arena, crafting (the crafting mechanic is really fun!), quests, and all kinds of random other stuff to keep you occupied when you need a break from the fights.

If you love ASCII art, get this game. If you love chiptunes, get this game. If you remember the BBSes, get this game.  Unless of course you demand fully rendered graphics and voiceovers with a minimap to point out exatly where you need to go and a million hints to hold your hand along the way...

13411537.review:
There's more depth in this one than one 1st assumes; there's lots of entertainment value hidden so far. You have to pay close attention during combat unlike many roguelikes which can be a pro or a con depending your playstyle of how you might sometimes plow through encounters. Only played 3 hours so far to make this review but will surely be adding to that total.

Recommend it.

13406158.review:
Hook up your 1200 baud modem because SanctuaryRPG is the best BBS RPG from 1987!

While I've never had the pleasure of BBS stuff, this game seems like something all the wealthy nerds would have spent countless hours playing back in the day.  Fun ASCII art with occasional & limited animation accompanied by great chiptunes help set the tone for this menu driven rogue-like.

That's right, this game is completely controlled by keyboard driven menus.  No mouses or gamepads need apply.  It's all pretty basic (even if the underlying game mechanics aren't) but enjoyable, if fairly repetitive.   I'm amused by the silly, occasionally mad-libs inspired humor and the infrequent events that breaks up combat and crafting.

This game has transitioned from donationware to a fully commercial product.  As I scribble this review, I feel there aren't many major improvements from 1.2.3, but since that version is dead (as far as development is concerned) this opinion will change with time.

Since Steam now has a demo, try it first.  I'll give this game a 7 out of 10... 7.5 if the developers get rid of the (lame) humanoid shaped blue slime.

13405576.review:

13402265.review:

13399109.review: I was very surprised by this game.  I didn't know fully what to expect when I loaded it up but what I've played thus far I find enjoying.  A nice mix of bizarre humor and fun gameplay with cool music and ASCII art.  The combat is what I particularily enjoy, it's not just hammer the attack button and win like a lot of RPG's, you have to link your attacks appropriately and reposition yourself to defend against attacks or get totally obliterated.  Anyone who looks at the game and thinks they might like it I am sure you will.  If you require flashy 3D graphics to enjoy a game then that is unfortunate, but there is a free vanilla version of the game to play on Black Shell Games' website so do yourself a favor by trying it out first and seeing for yourself.  I'm sure I've only scratched the surface of this game while playing it as far as what to expect and I can't wait to delve deeper.

13398400.review: I played Sanctuary RPG before it was on Steam, and it was a fun, hilarious, casual yet surprisingly deep strategy game with Role Playing elements. Just when you think you understand everything, it adds another mechanic that keeps things interesting, rather than being tedious or gimmicky. The Black edition adds even more about everything that made the standard edition great. There's always something new to discover that manages to be challenging and amusing. It's absolutely worth every penny.

13397490.review: I purchased and have been playing this game since W-A-Y before it came to Steam and let me tell you this game is AWESOME. I've managed to kill an entire weekend playing just this- one more hour, then I'll eat... one more hour, then I'll sleep... It's good now and the developer is mega with updates, a constant stream of them. WELL worth the money... a steal at TWICE the price!

13383409.review:
Not to mince words but this game is awesome.

I really do love the ASCII graphics in this game but not only that it is that the interface is quite easy to understand and intuitive. This game proves my mantra that I would rather have a great game with minimalist graphics that great graphics on a minimalist game.

The combat mechanics might be a bit repetitive but it does help to pay attention since it is quite dynamic and you can do extra attacks or moves depending on the current situation at hand, plus you can always reposition yourself for a better chance to hit hard.

I can't comment on the story since I died to early ahead for things to get interesting... although if I do have a gripe is that the randomness inserted in the game can get very juvenile, I don't mind the lolrandom type of humor but maybe do keep a lid on the potty jokes.

And speaking of the game it is hard although I usually find it me basically being on autopilot and ignoring certain things like thinking I could eventually dodge a charging enemy and delay a dodge only to find out that I am out of MP to heal myself.

I really do love the loot system and the simple crafting system as well, it does get a bit hard to get what you want exactly which is a bit frustrating that you want to use swords only for the game to constantly give you axes and bows, not that you are too handicapped if that happens just that the randomness might not work out for you.

One thing that I do gripe is that they did add a lot in this new version but there is nothing to show what you can actually do. If you are an old player jumping in new make sure you go to old places again so you don't miss any new stuff.

This game is awesome, I can reccomend it at the $5 asking price, in fact I got the key from donating a lesser ammount to the developer before but after playing this game I went back to his page and donated a couple more bucks to show that he definetly did a good job.

If you are on the fence about buying the game then allow me to push over the buy side of the fence then.

13372901.review:

13372892.review: I don't usually write reviews, but thought this game was worth it. I'm on my third playthrough (2 on the free version), and can't believe how much fun a game with no graphics can be. If you like turn based roguelikes then this game is well worth the price. I have not experienced any bugs so don't let the early access tag scare you off. This version has a bunch more things to do than the free version, but the combat seems to be the same. Get it and enjoy some ASCII art and 8 bit music.

13372875.review:
This game is absolutely fantastic and hilarious, but until they make hyper trample at least semi-close in damage to any other mechanic in the game, then this game really doesn't have to right to have perma-death.

A normal enemy many levels below you can do 5 times the damage of a bosses ult with a hyper trample and insta-kill you at any point, it is the only thing that seems to ever kill me or anyone else I know who has played this game. It is ludicrously powerful, seemingly possible for any enemy, and even if you ONLY upgrade vitality it can and will kill you at full life in one hit. 

If I'm going to lose I want it to be from the game, not just hyper trample. It's a dinner plate sized blemish on the face of a game that is amazing in nearly every other way. Until this type of attack is overhauled, it changes the whole game to focus around making damn well sure you attacked in the right rhythm to be able to dodge it, and if you can't or if you are snared, then you instantly lose everything you've ever worked for. Period. The game in its current form revolves around avoiding this singular mechanic far and above anything else, and it trivializes the game in its entirety. 

*Edit*

The game has been patched since I wrote the above review, and although hyper trample still poses a massive threat there are now more appropriate means of mitigation. That being said, even later in the game when you are decked out it won't be uncommon for it to hit for 50% of your health. But at the very least you can eventually achieve the ability to not die in the event you are forced to tank a hit from the attack.

Due to the dev's close attention to the issue and the fact the game is utterly fantastic in every other quality, I would consider this game worth buying despite a few of the more annoying combat mechanics.

13371689.review:
Poked myself in the eye to check if a man really gave me a potato. 

A humourous texted based rouge-like that is both great for anyone who likes the genre with a Hardcore mode that results in permadeath, or a Casual mode that will let you finish the story if you don't like the idea of losing all your progress. 
Music is great, reminding me of the older Final Fantasy games but with more variant to them. 
Graphics are amazing considering everything is ascii art, with multitude of colors used, and a nice and simple looking menu system. 
6 Classes to explore, with a lot of different racial benefits to pick from. 
A simple to use Crafting system, and even easier to use equipment system. 

My only downside would be when grinding out levels the the wait time between starting the fight (an animation leading to the fight) and waiting on the Item Drop animation if you find something makes grinding feel so much longer. But other than that have enjoyed everything so far.

13370170.review: Played this game since early, early beta. An overall great roguelike RPG with impressive ASCII backgrounds and characters! Hope to see even more content and music added when this game reaches final! :D

13369220.review: I've been playing this game for quite a while before it's steam release and all I can say is this :SanctuaryRPG takes a risk with it's art style in today's day, but still comes out on top.  It does what roguelikes do best.  Challenging, rewarding, and deep gameplay makes this roguelike shine amongst the others.  This is not your normal text adventure.

13367874.review:
SanctuaryRPG to dosyć typowo nietypowy RPG, którego charakteryzuje w szczególności grafika ASCII oraz całkiem niezły humor.
Naprawdę ciężko mi jakkolwiek sensownie opisać tą gierkę jako że jest ona bardzo unikatowa i to jedna z tych produkcji w którą najlepiej zagrać po prostu, bo nijak do końca nie da się opisać jej uroku. W praktyce to bowiem zwykły rpg z elementami roguelike. Tworzymy postać, nadajemy imię, określamy wygląd, pochodzenie i klasę, a następnie ruszamy w nie tak mały świat, po drodze walcząc z niezliczoną ilością potworków wszelkiej maści. Brzmi znajomo? Bo i jest, bardzo łatwo idzie odnaleźć się w samej grze, przez co szybko zyskujemy pełną wiedzą potrzebną do stania się niepokonanym herosem... lub zginiemy próbując stworzyć swoją legendę, bo i tak zdarzyć się może.
Na czym więc polega urok tej gierki po za tym że niejako kopiuje typowy ugrany system średniego RPG'a? Otóż niespotykana dziś grafika ASCII jak i całkiem niezły humor jaki gra nam zapewnia potrafi przyciągnąć równie mocno, o ile nie mocniej a niżeli w przypadku innych średniawych RPG'ów. Grafika bowiem choć prosta i wymaga wyobraźni to jednak naprawdę jest przyjemna dla oka i zwykle nie mamy większego problemu z określeniem na co w tej chwili patrzymy. Same dialogi i wszelkiej maści deskrypcję są natomiast napisane z delikatnym przymrużeniem oka, co mnie osobiście bardzo się spodobało. SanctuaryRPG nie próbuje określać się jako Skyrim z grafiką ASCII, to nie jest wielki poważny RPG, tylko bardzo lekki jego odpowiednik i to nie tak mały jak mogło by się wydawać bo i świat jest całkiem spory, mimo iż na początku zbytnio sobie nie pozwiedzamy.
Jeśli chodzi o mechanikę w sensie walki, jest to dosyć zwykła turówka, przedstawiona bardzo klarowanie przez co nikt nie powinien mieć problemów w zorientowaniu się co się dzieje i jaki kolejny ruch będzie najlepszy, bowiem może łączyć ciosy w dłuższe kombinacje, leczyć się, przemieszczać się, czy uciekać, a jako że wszystko przedstawione jest w postaci tekstowej gdzie każda akcja jest dodatkowo odpowiednio opisana, walka staje się czystą przyjemnością. Na początku może nawet wydawać się całkiem łatwą, jednak należy do niektórych wrogów podchodzić z nie małą dozą ostrożności bo tak jak my mamy całkiem sporo możliwości w walce, tak samo tą swobodę mają przeciwnicy i niedocenienie przeciwnika może się skończyć naszą śmiercią o wiele szybciej niż mogło by się nam wydawać. Należy więc jednak z rozmysłem rozwijać postać i dodatkowe skille tak by to jednak nasza postać okazałą się być najlepszym z najlepszych.

Najprościej więc ujmując, polecam gierkę każdemu fanowi dosyć tradycyjnych RPGów. Tych których zraża zaś niecodzienna konieczność sterowania w grze, czy grafika ASCII pragnę zapewnić że jeśli dacie SanctuaryRPG szansę to i najpewniej nie pożałujecie.
Odradzam tą produkcję jedynie tym którzy nie znają za dobrze języka angielskiego, jako że gra jest pełna tekstu, a zrozumienie tego jest kluczowe do jej przejścia jak i zrozumienia przedstawionego w niej humoru.

Pozdrawiam.

13365866.review:

13361427.review:
I didn't know what to expect. SanctuaryRPG had good reviews, and always a stickler for everything RPG I bought it for the low price of 4.99.  Next thing I know I've been playing for an hour and a half and enjoyed every minute of it.  This can certainly be called a text based game, in some sense, due to the ASCII graphics- which is a good thing because of the graphics. There also isn't a lot of hand holding, but the various help/guides deliver what you need to know without giving to much away.  I really don't know what to expect at each turn.  This makes it a great exploration game.  I thought I was turning in a quest...next thing I know I'm an owner an operator of my very own bar- a profitable one too!  Minutes later I'm stabbing a doctor in the face because I don't want to hear him talk anymore.

-Great game, can't wait to keep exploring
-Great 8 bit sound effects and music
-complex combat system
-Early into it, but I can tell the character development is well thought out.  Though I haven't had any problem with the enemies yet, i hope the character / skill building is a crucial meta-game for winning.  

For 4.99 I couldn't receommended it enough. The great writing (suprising and humorous) is worth the play alone and will devour your time.

13359990.review: I've been playing this game since it was announced (or close enough, anyway) and it's pretty amazing. The ASCII art is beautiful, the mechanics are solid and the gameplay is fun. I highly recommend.

13359283.review:

Juego hilarante, he estado jugando y su modo rougue-like es muy desafiante. Lo recomiendo si estas buscando una nueva experiencia en el campo.

13356022.review:
I don't write many reviews as I am more of a gamer of actions and less of words, but I had to write one for this game as its an example of a rare gem in the crop of many many games out there (and I have quite a few). I'm also deliberately reviewing it low in the playtime so I can cleanly state the facts as a fresh player, without the bias more hours would bring.

What's the game like? Well simply put, its an old skool RPG Rogue-Like tactical combat game. It has the feel of an old adventure game from the 80s meshed with a TBS from the 90s, a sort of cross between a Rogue and Final Fantasy, with a hint of Douglas's adams Hitchikers Guide to the Galaxy for whimsy and charm and a 1st person Ultima game played in ASCII first person for the map. The mix of games sounds like a mess, it should not work, but in reality it holds together well as you have an interesting non-cliche RPG story with humour and a quest to finish, but is fleshed out with other elements like crafting, town base building by using cratables to upgrade the town, random procedual generated dungeons on the map and in the arena in town, all of which ties into the whole experince.

If you are a fan of the old school, early 90s rogue likes and your ultimas and final fanstasy games, please buy this game, as it has this vibe in spades. Also would highly recommend buying if your interested in combat tactics and not just pressing 1 to cast spell or 2 to drink potion, as like MMORPGS and some offline RPGS, your number keys do your class actions (of which there are many) but there is quite alot going on screen at any point, and any tactical errors such as forgetting to heal when bleeding out in one of the rounds, or forgetting to dodge at certain points will lead to death.

In terms of downsides, it does get hard later in the game and you really do need to know how your class skills interact and behave to survive later on and not be dispatched in quick order (but this may also be seen as a positive) and there may be some intitial getting used the interface needed as there is alot going on the screen per turn and when wandering around landscapes and towns, but if you willing to stick with it you get used to the ASCII style quickly.

In summary it's a game that is packaged in a unique, old skool style but it's one that understands the flows of a more modern tatical TBS game while not sacrificing what it means to be old skool in the first place, presented in great quality. That last scentence may not make sense unless you play it, but it is as it is.

13353926.review:
Awesome ASCII art, amazing music, awesome humour, awesome mechanics, awesome potatoes.

Potato/10

13353899.review:
When 33 years ago RIchard Garriott, known as Lord British, released first Ultima, it was his 30th computer rpg game. 28 of his first games were made on some mainframe university computer and playable with terrible lag via teletype, or as we call them today a terminal.
I'm not sure if author of SanctuaryRPG had exactly this reference in mind, but could have been played via ssh or teletype. It also has ASCII graphics (not just roguelike maps, but ascii-art), sound, music and very detailed gameplay with wacky old-school science fantasy story.
This game is a must for everyone who'd like to play some old school rpg, even if they're afraid to - it's easy to catch up, surprisingly good looking and hardcore to the bone.

13353588.review: I have played this game since it was first anounced and it has only gotten better. I orginally started out just finding a lot of bugs which led to me talking the lead developer a lot and he ended up asking me to be a tester for him and now I'm one of the three community managers for SanctuaryRPG! There was once a time when I had the time to put enough hours in to get each class to level 100 which was the max at the time and my goal to get to max level again and add a lot of hours to my already a lot of hours I have put in(has to be atleast 100 hours alread). I recomend this to people that love ACSII art, text based games, and amazing 8-bit music(the game's music has to be the music of gods).

Been playing this game since April and have put in many, many hours. Buy it. Support the developers. Become Barbarian. Kill dragons and slimes. Get murdered by critical hits. Do it all over again as a wizard.

13352619.review: I've been playing this since the early donation builds.  It was a great game then and it's even better now.  Black Edition adds a lot of new customization and mechanics.  SanctuaryRPG is a text based rougelike game, that makes me wish I could have grown up in the days of DOS.  For $4.99 USD, this is a no brainer.
